properties.name: algorithm
properties.description: • algorithm - (Required) The name of the algorithm to use for the key. Currently-supported values are "RSA" and "ECDSA".

properties.name: rsa_bits
properties.description: • rsa_bits - (Optional) When algorithm is "RSA", the size of the generated RSA key in bits. Defaults to 2048.

properties.name: ecdsa_curve
properties.description: • ecdsa_curve - (Optional) When algorithm is "ECDSA", the name of the elliptic curve to use. May be any one of "P224", "P256", "P384" or "P521", with "P224" as the default.

properties.name: key_algorithm
properties.description: • key_algorithm - (Required) The name of the algorithm for the key provided in private_key_pem.

properties.name: private_key_pem
properties.description: • private_key_pem - (Required) PEM-encoded private key data. This can be read from a separate file using the file interpolation function. If the certificate is being generated to be used for a throwaway development environment or other non-critical application, the tls_private_key resource can be used to generate a TLS private key from within Terraform. Only an irreversable secure hash of the private key will be stored in the Terraform state.

properties.name: subject
properties.description: • subject - (Required) The subject for which a certificate is being requested. This is a nested configuration block whose structure matches the corresponding block for tls_cert_request.

properties.name: validity_period_hours
properties.description: • validity_period_hours - (Required) The number of hours after initial issuing that the certificate will become invalid.

properties.name: allowed_uses
properties.description: • allowed_uses - (Required) List of keywords each describing a use that is permitted for the issued certificate. The valid keywords are listed below.

properties.name: dns_names
properties.description: • dns_names - (Optional) List of DNS names for which a certificate is being requested.

properties.name: ip_addresses
properties.description: • ip_addresses - (Optional) List of IP addresses for which a certificate is being requested.

properties.name: uris
properties.description: • uris - (Optional) List of URIs for which a certificate is being requested.

properties.name: early_renewal_hours
properties.description: • early_renewal_hours - (Optional) If set, the resource will consider the certificate to have expired the given number of hours before its actual expiry time. This can be useful to deploy an updated certificate in advance of the expiration of the current certificate. Note however that the old certificate remains valid until its true expiration time, since this resource does not (and cannot) support certificate revocation. Note also that this advance update can only be performed should the Terraform configuration be applied during the early renewal period.

properties.name: is_ca_certificate
properties.description: • is_ca_certificate - (Optional) Boolean controlling whether the CA flag will be set in the generated certificate. Defaults to false, meaning that the certificate does not represent a certificate authority.

properties.name: set_subject_key_id
properties.description: • set_subject_key_id - (Optional) If true, the certificate will include the subject key identifier. Defaults to false, in which case the subject key identifier is not set at all.
The allowed_uses list accepts the following keywords, combining the set of flags defined by both Key Usage and Extended Key Usage in RFC5280:

properties.name: ca_key_algorithm
properties.description: • ca_key_algorithm - (Required) The name of the algorithm for the key provided in ca_private_key_pem.

properties.name: ca_private_key_pem
properties.description: • ca_private_key_pem - (Required) PEM-encoded private key data for the CA. This can be read from a separate file using the file interpolation function.

properties.name: ca_cert_pem
properties.description: • ca_cert_pem - (Required) PEM-encoded certificate data for the CA.

properties.name: validity_period_hours
properties.description: • validity_period_hours - (Required) The number of hours after initial issuing that the certificate will become invalid.

properties.name: allowed_uses
properties.description: • allowed_uses - (Required) List of keywords each describing a use that is permitted for the issued certificate. The valid keywords are listed below.

properties.name: early_renewal_hours
properties.description: • early_renewal_hours - (Optional) If set, the resource will consider the certificate to have expired the given number of hours before its actual expiry time. This can be useful to deploy an updated certificate in advance of the expiration of the current certificate. Note however that the old certificate remains valid until its true expiration time, since this resource does not (and cannot) support certificate revocation. Note also that this advance update can only be performed should the Terraform configuration be applied during the early renewal period.

properties.name: is_ca_certificate
properties.description: • is_ca_certificate - (Optional) Boolean controlling whether the CA flag will be set in the generated certificate. Defaults to false, meaning that the certificate does not represent a certificate authority.

properties.name: set_subject_key_id
properties.description: • set_subject_key_id - (Optional) If true, the certificate will include the subject key identifier. Defaults to false, in which case the subject key identifier is not set at all.
The allowed_uses list accepts the following keywords, combining the set of flags defined by both Key Usage and Extended Key Usage in RFC5280:

properties.name: key_algorithm
properties.description: • key_algorithm - (Required) The name of the algorithm for the key provided in private_key_pem.

properties.name: private_key_pem
properties.description: • private_key_pem - (Required) PEM-encoded private key data. This can be read from a separate file using the file interpolation function. Only an irreversable secure hash of the private key will be stored in the Terraform state.

properties.name: subject
properties.description: • subject - (Required) The subject for which a certificate is being requested. This is a nested configuration block whose structure is described below.

properties.name: dns_names
properties.description: • dns_names - (Optional) List of DNS names for which a certificate is being requested.

properties.name: ip_addresses
properties.description: • ip_addresses - (Optional) List of IP addresses for which a certificate is being requested.

properties.name: uris
properties.description: • uris - (Optional) List of URIs for which a certificate is being requested.
The nested subject block accepts the following arguments, all optional, with their meaning corresponding to the similarly-named attributes defined in RFC5280:

Note: Versions of this provider prior to 1.2.0 may generate a certificate request which cannot be validated by your Certificate Authority if the * character is used in any of the subject fields, for example as part of the common_name when generating a request for a wildcard certificate. Strings containing a * and passed to the dns_names argument are encoded correctly.
